CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Both copolymers also exhibited high J SC s and FFs , indicating their decent ability for charge generation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

1. copolymers

The term "copolymers" refers to a type of polymer where at least two different types of monomers are used in the polymerization process. Copolymers can have various properties depending on the monomers used and their arrangement in the polymer chain. In this context, the paragraph is discussing the properties of specific copolymers, so it is the Material Name entity in this sentence.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Both copolymers also exhibited high J SC s and FFs , indicating their decent ability for charge generation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

1. J SC: This is a property name referring to the short-circuit current density, which is a measure of the maximum current that can flow through a photovoltaic device under standard test conditions.
2. FF: This is another property name referring to the fill factor, which is a measure of the maximum reversible output power that can be achieved by a photovoltaic device under standard test conditions, relative to the product of the open-circuit voltage and short-circuit current.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. J SC: This is a material property referring to the short-circuit current density.
2. FF: This is a material property referring to the fill factor.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| short-circuit current density (J SC) |
| fill factor (FF) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Both copolymers also exhibited high J SC s and FFs , indicating their decent ability for charge generation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

1. copolymers: These are not directly property values, but rather the entities that have the properties being discussed in the paragraph.
2. high J SCs: J SC stands for "short-circuit current density," which is a measure of the ability of a material to generate electrical current. So, "high J SCs" is a property value for the copolymers.
3. high FFs: FF stands for "fill factor," which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electricity. So, "high FFs" is another property value for the copolymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. high J SCs (short-circuit current density)
2. high FFs (fill factor)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| high J SCs (short-circuit current density) |
| high FFs (fill factor) |
